intro: Phyllanthus deflexus, commonly known as the flexible spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or herb, with stems that can be erect or prostrate depending on the environment. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a serrated or lobed margin, while the flowers are unisexual and borne in cyathia. Phyllanthus deflexus is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
